result.execSummary:
The defendant Toni E Hawkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Toni E Hawkins is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Toni E Hawkins was found guilty of Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge paid in full from bond from 16CF389.
Defendant shall not use/possess alcohol, drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances.  Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence toward anyone.
Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: 7/21/16 Crt orders 120 days conditional jail time be imposed with treatment release privileges or upon completion of AODA Intensive Outpatient Treatment.
9/29/16: Court orders 120 days conditional jail time or until placement at treatment facility.

supervisions.notes: Concur to 16CF465 but consec to any other sentence. Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant shall not use/possess alcohol, drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Shall not possess any controlled substance with a valid prescription unless has agent's written approval. Shall not lie.
Random searches of home, car and property for contraband. Participate in and successfully complete Thinking for Change or similar program.  Random UA & BA testing at minimum of every 2 wks.

Copy given defn.

Defendant Toni E Hawkins in court with Attorney Brian Gleason.  Prosecuting Atty Robert J Jambois appeared for State of Wisconsin.   State moves to amend complaint to defendant's height of 5'1" and 120 lbs.  Statement by Atty Gleason.  Court will take under advisement and make a determination later in the hearing.  Testimony taken.  Witness identified defendant.  Venue established.  Exhibit #1 marked and identified and offered.  Argument by Attorney Gleason.  Argument by ADA Jambois.  Court admits Exhibit #1.  Reasons outlined on record.  Cross-exam by Atty Gleason.  ADA moves court to find probable cause that a felony was committed and that the defendant committed the felony.   Argument by Atty Gleason and moves for dismissal.  Response by ADA Jambois.  Court finds probable cause and binds case over.  Court grants ADA's earlier motion to amend complaint as it relates to defendant's height of 5'1" and 120 lbs.  Case bound over to Br 11.  Copy of Info given defn.  Atty Gleason states he will be filing a substitution on Br 11.    Set case for argn.
Atty Gleason
and proposed order for bail modification. Order not signed as modification was ordered at hearing
W/D per CP, Br 4.
Preliminary hearing at 10-14-2015 11:00 am

Defn missed PH yesterday, but came in later in the day on 10/2/15.  She was directed to go to SPD.  Atty Gleason was appointed having represented here previously.   Atty Gleason states defn already posted $500 bail.  Court noted she was unavailable yesterday afternoon at other hearings.  Stipulation and Order for bail modification presented to court, but now that the parties are on the record, the stip may not be necessary.  Atty Schlipper is in agreement with the stip and order to quash bench warrant and reinstate bail and set prel hearing.  Defn to get notice in hand for next hearing.  Court quashes bench warrant and reinstates bail.   Court will set prel hearing for 10/14/15 @ 11:00 a.m. and this is within the 20 day time limits.  Bench warrant withdrawn by the court - Sheriff's Dept notified.
